<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e7525c552060dd04aacdbca6bb5fe6460cf4da60|patch 8.2.2318: Vim9: string and list index work differently>
patch 8.2.2318: Vim9: string and list index work differently

Problem:    Vim9: string and list index work differently.
Solution:   Make string index work like list index. (closes #7643)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2318: Vim9: string and list index work differently · vim/vim@e7525c5
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2318: Vim9: string and list index work differently · vim/vim@e7525c5
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: string and list index work differently. Solution: Make string index work like list index. (closes #7643)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9e0f883f89c915e08ef5fd9e6bf382af57fa9eb2|patch 8.2.2317: Vim9: command modifier before list unpack doesn't work>
patch 8.2.2317: Vim9: command modifier before list unpack doesn't work

Problem:    Vim9: command modifier before list unpack doesn't work.
Solution:   Only recognize "[" directly after the name. (closes #7641)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2317: Vim9: command modifier before list unpack doesn't work · vim/vim@9e0f883
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2317: Vim9: command modifier before list unpack doesn't work · vim/vim@9e0f883
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: command modifier before list unpack doesn't work. Solution: Only recognize "[" directly after the name. (closes #7641)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/b657198cb30765468451d7f68fce49b5b4000c5d|patch 8.2.2316: Vim9: cannot list a lambda function>
patch 8.2.2316: Vim9: cannot list a lambda function

Problem:    Vim9: cannot list a lambda function.
Solution:   Support the 9 notation, like :disassemble. (closes #7634)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2316: Vim9: cannot list a lambda function · vim/vim@b657198
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2316: Vim9: cannot list a lambda function · vim/vim@b657198

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/832ea89ca90cdff019ee7cf31d5c44bfa164313a|patch 8.2.2315: Vim9: "enddef" as dict key misintepreted as function end>
patch 8.2.2315: Vim9: "enddef" as dict key misintepreted as function end

Problem:    Vim9: "enddef" as dict key misintepreted as function end.
Solution:   Check for following colon. (closes #7640)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2315: Vim9: "enddef" as dict key misintepreted as function end · vim/vim@832ea89

attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: "enddef" as dict key misintepreted as function end. Solution: Check for following colon. (closes #7640)

patch 8.2.2314: Vim9: returning zero takes two instructions

Problem:    Vim9: returning zero takes two instructions.
Solution:   Add ISN_RETURN_ZERO.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2314: Vim9: returning zero takes two instructions · vim/vim@299f303
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2314: Vim9: returning zero takes two instructions · vim/vim@299f303

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ece0b87c0fb0e35ff4c51f9ba81389f56428e42b|patch 8.2.2313: Vim9: using uninitialized field when parsing range>
patch 8.2.2313: Vim9: using uninitialized field when parsing range

Problem:    Vim9: using uninitialized field when parsing range. ":silent!" not
            respected when parsing range fails.
Solution:   Initialize ea.skip.  On pattern failure handle it like an error.
            (closes #7636)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2313: Vim9: using uninitialized field when parsing range · vim/vim@ece0b87
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2313: Vim9: using uninitialized field when parsing range · vim/vim@ece0b87
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: using uninitialized field when parsing range. &quot;:silent!&quot; not respected when parsing range fails. Solution: Initialize ea.skip. On pattern failure handle i...
